meanings.definition: A feeling of great happiness and triumph.
meanings.sent1: The team's jubilation was evident after winning the championship.
meanings.sent2: The whole town erupted in jubilation when the missing child was found safe.
meanings.sent3: The jubilation at the surprise party was so loud that the neighbors joined in the celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her heart danced with jubilation as she received the long-awaited acceptance letter.
meanings.sent5: The jubilation in the air was contagious, spreading joy to all who witnessed the victory.

meanings.definition: The act of rejoicing or celebrating.
meanings.sent1: The jubilation at the wedding was infectious, with everyone dancing and laughing.
meanings.sent2: The jubilation of the crowd filled the stadium as the winning goal was scored.
meanings.sent3: The jubilation of the puppies playing in the park brought smiles to all who passed by.
meanings.sent4: The jubilation of nature's beauty was evident in the colorful sunset over the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The jubilation of the students echoed through the school halls on the last day of exams.
